resources.string: Let’s connect your Somneo to your WiFi so you can enjoy all the app enabled features!
Important: For a reliable connection, make sure you have a strong WiFi signal where you are setting up.
Let\'s confirm the WiFi network to which we’ll connect your Philips Somneo
Do you want to connect your Somneo to this WiFi network?
Plug your Sleep&Wake-Up Light into an electricity socket.
Do you see this screen on the display and the icon blinking on the display of your Philips Wake-Up Light?
Press play and follow the setup on the screen of your Sleep&Wake-Up Light until you see this screen.
To reset the device please turn around your Philips Sleep&Wake-Up Light and press the end of a paper clip in the hole between the plug and the USB entrance (see picture). Wait for 30 seconds.
Select your Somneo from the list of available WiFi networks on your phone
1. Go to your WiFi settings.\n2. Select \'PHILIPS Setup\'-network.\n3. Return to this app.
Connect your Somneo to the selected WiFi
Give your Somneo a unique name
Now connecting your Somneo to your network. This might take a few seconds. You will be redirected automatically when finished.
Your Philips is now connected to your home WiFi network and paired with your phone.
Please read all 4 steps before leaving the application. 1. Tap WiFi in your phone Settings 2. Make sure your WiFi is turned on 3. Select your home network 4. Return to the Philips %1$s
Is another phone connected to your Somneo ?
If your Somneo was connected to another phone, this won\'t work now. But we can help!
On your Somneo\'s screen, do you see the screen below?
No, that\'s not what I see
Enable your Somneo to connect to a new phone
On your Philips tap the \"<\" icon, to go back a step. Once this is complete, you should see the \"ready to connect\" screen.
This will allow your Somneo to connect to a new phone by placing it back into access point mode (icon blinking mode).
Has your Somneo been set up in the past?
If your Somneo is showing a full menu, it may have been set up to connect to another network in the past.\nLet\'s reset the connection to fix it.
On your Somneo, tap the \"Settings\" icon, find the WiFi settings icon and press it for 8 seconds.

Please check your phone’s WiFi settings to ensure that your phone can connect to 2.4 GHz WiFi signals. If your phone is set to discover WiFi networks only at 5 GHz, it will not be able to connect to the Philips Somneo\'s WiFi signal.
We’d be happy to help with any questions you still might have.
If you need support or help with your product, please reach out whichever way is most convenient to you.
Contact us For any questions you might have.\nContact details can be found via the more-tab

The phone could not detect your Somneo in Home WiFi.
This may be because you entered the wrong password or because your Somneo is out of range.

Please verify your password, move your device and phone closer to your home router and try again.

If problems persist,please click the "different issue" link below.
Learn how to place your Somneo back into access point mode.
Please verify your password, move your Somneo & phone closer to your home router, and try again. If problems persist, please tap \"still having issues\" below.

In order to establish a connection, the router settings for your home network must be set to 2.4 GHz bandwidth, allow new devices to connect, and allow network devices to communicate with each another.
We’d be happy to help with any questions you still might have.
Are you sure you want to skip WiFi setup?
If you skip WiFi setup now, you will not be able to control your device using your app.\n\nTo connect at a later time, go to the \"More section\" tab in your app and select \"Add a device\".
GPS is disabled.You need to enable location services to complete the pairing. Then press back to return to the app.
Is this icon blinking on the display on your Somneo?

In order to establish a connection you router settings have to be correct. UPNP has to be enabled to allow devices to communicate to each other.\nYour router network should not be a guest network. Please see your router manual.
Continue on your wake up light
I have not yet started the installation from my Wake-Up Light or I want to start over again
I have started or completed the installation from my Wake-Up Light
In case this icon is blinking on the display of your Wake-Up Light press yes.

The phone could not detect %1$s in home Wi-Fi

This may be because:
1) You entered the wrong password
2) Your %1$s is out of range

Please verify your password, move your %1$s and phone close to %2$s router and try again. If you have another router or network, you can try use those.
Note: Your %1$s does not support 5Ghz networks.

Your phone has connected to a different network. 

Please reconnect your phone to %1$s.
Please read all the 4 steps before leaving the application.
1. Tap Wi-Fi in your phone settings 
2. Make sure your Wi-Fi is turned on 
3. Select your home network
4. Return to the %2$s app
Enable the setup mode on the device.
Enable the setup mode on the device.
Usually you can setup the device in this state.
Accidentally connect with the wrong phone?
If your device has been connected to another phone by accident, you may see this screen prematurely.
